security_audit.summary: This is an official Anthropic skill for presentation file operations. It reads, creates, and modifies local .pptx files using standard file operations. No network calls, no external commands execution, no sensitive environment access.

content.value_statement: Creating polished PowerPoint presentations from scratch or modifying existing templates requires complex OOXML manipulation and precise layout control. This skill provides automated workflows for HTML-to-PPTX conversion, template-based slide generation, and direct OOXML editing for advanced customization.
actual_capabilities: Create presentations from scratch using HTML-to-PPTX conversion with PptxGenJS
Edit existing presentations by unpacking OOXML, modifying XML, and repacking
Duplicate and rearrange slides from templates using index-based selection
Extract text inventories and apply formatted replacements to placeholder text
Generate visual thumbnail grids for slide analysis and review
Add charts, tables, shapes, and images with precise positioning
limitations: Cannot directly edit PPTX files without using OOXML unpacking workflow
CSS gradients and unsupported fonts must be rasterized as PNG images first
Inline elements do not support margins or padding in PowerPoint text runs
Complex animations and transitions require manual OOXML editing

use_cases.title: Automated deck creation
use_cases.description: Generate quarterly review presentations by converting HTML mockups to formatted slides with charts and data visualizations.

use_cases.title: Template-based campaigns
use_cases.description: Apply brand templates by duplicating and reordering slides, then replacing placeholder text with campaign content.

use_cases.title: Course material slides
use_cases.description: Convert lesson outlines into presentations with consistent styling, bullet lists, and visual placeholders for diagrams.

prompt_templates.title: Create simple deck
prompt_templates.scenario: Make a basic title and content slides
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a 5-slide presentation about [topic] using html2pptx. Include a title slide, 3 content slides with bullet points, and a closing slide. Use web-safe fonts and a professional color palette.

prompt_templates.title: Add chart slides
prompt_templates.prompt: Add a chart slide to the presentation. Create placeholder area in HTML using class="placeholder", then add a [bar/line/pie] chart showing [data description] using PptxGenJS API.

prompt_templates.title: Edit template
prompt_templates.prompt: Edit the existing template.pptx file. Unpack it using ooxml/scripts/unpack.py, then modify the text on slides 1-3. Replace placeholder text with [new content] and preserve original formatting. Validate and repack the file.

prompt_templates.title: Bulk slide operations
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new presentation from template.pptx using only slides 0, 2, 4, 5, and 7. Duplicate slide 5 twice for repeated content sections. Apply replacement text from replacement-text.json to all shapes.

output_examples.input: Create a 3-slide presentation about climate change with a title slide, one slide with key facts, and a closing slide asking for action.
output: Slide 1: Title "Climate Change: Understanding the Challenge" with subtitle
Slide 2: Key facts in bullet list format (5 items)
Slide 3: Closing slide with call-to-action message
All slides use 16:9 layout with consistent teal and coral color palette

best_practices: Always validate presentations immediately after editing and before repacking to catch OOXML errors
Use web-safe fonts only (Arial, Helvetica, Georgia) to ensure consistent rendering across systems
Create visual thumbnail grids to review slide layouts before finalizing presentations
anti_patterns: Do not manually add bullet symbols in text - use <ul> or <ol> HTML lists for proper formatting
Do not use CSS gradients directly - rasterize them as PNG images first with Sharp
Do not reference non-existent slides or shapes in replacement JSON files

faq.question: What file formats can I create presentations in?
faq.answer: This skill creates .pptx files (PowerPoint 2007+ format). The html2pptx workflow supports 16:9, 4:3, and 16:10 layouts.

faq.question: What are the limits on slide count or file size?
faq.answer: No strict limits exist but very large presentations (100+ slides) may require more memory. The thumbnail generator creates multiple grid images for decks over 30 slides.

faq.question: Can I use this skill with existing PowerPoint templates?
faq.answer: Yes. Use the rearrange.py script to duplicate slides by index, then replace.py to update placeholder text with your content while preserving template styling.

faq.question: Is my data safe when editing presentations?
faq.answer: All file operations are local. No data is sent externally. Original files are preserved until validation confirms the edited file is valid.

faq.question: Why does my presentation fail to open in PowerPoint?
faq.answer: Common causes include invalid OOXML references, missing relationship declarations, or unescaped Unicode characters. Always run validate.py after editing to catch these issues.

faq.question: How does this compare to using the PowerPoint API directly?
faq.answer: This skill works at the OOXML level without requiring PowerPoint installed. Files can be created and edited on any system, making it ideal for automated pipelines and CI/CD workflows.
